name: Central Cee
description:
'''Oakley Neil Caesar-Su''' (born 4 June 1998), known professionally as '''Central Cee''', is a British rapper from [[Shepherd's Bush]], [[London]]. Regarded as a leading figure in [[UK rap]], he rose to prominence in 2020 with the release of his [[UK drill|drill]] singles "Day in the Life" and "Loading". His first mixtape, ''[[Wild West (mixtape)|Wild West]]'' (2021), debuted at number two on the [[UK Albums Chart]], while his second, ''[[23 (mixtape)|23]]'' (2022), debuted atop the chart.

Central Cee achieved further success with his 2022 single "[[Doja (Central Cee song)|Doja]]", which peaked at number two on the [[UK Singles Chart]] and became the then-most-streamed UK rap song on Spotify. In June 2023, he released the single "[[Sprinter (song)|Sprinter]]" (with [[Dave (rapper)|Dave]]), which became his first [[Lists of UK Singles Chart number ones|UK number-one]] single and preceded their collaborative EP, ''[[Split Decision (EP)|Split Decision]]'' (2023). The song also became the longest-running number-one rap song in the UK, holding the position for 10 weeks. In April 2024, it became the most streamed UK rap song ever, surpassing "Doja". That May, Central Cee released the single "[[Band4Band]]" with [[Lil Baby]], which became the highest charting UK rap single in [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] history, reaching number 18, as well as reaching number 3 in his home country. His debut studio album, ''[[Can't Rush Greatness]]'', was released in 2025 through [[Columbia Records]] and became his second number-one on the UK Albums Chart. It also debuted at number nine on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]], becoming the first top-ten UK rap album in America.
